## Flow.exec() method

Execute all node function one by one, the previous output is the next input, until the last output would be return to the caller.

**Signature:**

```typescript
exec(input: T, logger: Logger | undefined): Promise<FlowNodeReturn<T>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

input


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The input of the first `FlowNode`


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

logger


</td><td>

Logger \| undefined


</td><td>

Logger to print log, `undefined` means to hide all log.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[FlowNodeReturn](./tsrpc-base-client.flownodereturn.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;&gt;


## Remarks

If any node function return `null | undefined`<!-- -->, or throws an error, the latter node functions would not be executed. And it would return `null | undefined` immediately to the caller, which tell the caller it means a interruption, to let the caller stop latter behaviours.
